short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Emacs editing from within Chrome, especially Chromebooks.  Works offline.  Based on ymacs.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
http://www.ymacs.org/ extended to work as a chrome app, giving access to local files and all keystrokes (C-n, C-w, and C-t).  On chromebooks, local files even includes Google Drive.  

Still in early development, but self hosted development works.  Soon to come: more traditional file name handling support, then dired and M-x grep

A Hackathon project by Pace Willisson <pace@alum.mit.edu> and Eric Willisson <eric.willisson@gmail.com>
